metadata.title: CVE-2022-48303 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
GNU Tar through 1.34 has a one-byte out-of-bounds read that results in useof uninitialized memory for a conditional jump. Exploitation to change theflow of control has not been demonstrated. The issue occurs in from_headerin list.c via a V7 archive in which mtime has approximately 11 whitespacecharacters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tar - 1.34+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1.22.04.1
tar-scripts - 1.34+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tar package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.34+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1.22.04.1').
